channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dangerously leaning wall. Partially collapsed., 14th February
item.description:
The wall at this property has been dangerously leaning for years. Part of it is already collapsed. It is still at great risk of collapsing further and causing serious injury to pedestrians, or worse. I understand that this is a private property and not necessarily under local authorities control, but surely there should be a way of pushing the owners of the property to act, due to the danger.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Highfield Avenue, Brent Cross, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned bin, 14th February
item.description:
This bin has been here waiting for collection for over 6 weeks. It’s not been collected because the owner ( not me) has put normal waste into a green topped bin that should be for garden waste. However they are never going to remove it and the council have now left it over 6 weeks and won’t collect it either! Why can’t the normal grey lid collection not just empty it! It’s had rats and foxes all over it and more rubbish then gets dumped there too. I understand that the public should use the right bins but at what point will you collect it when the owner clearly won’t do anything about it. As residents we shouldn’t have to sit and look at it for 6 weeks when we’ve paid our council tax to clean the streets!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Hill View Drive, Thamesmead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.category: Fly-tip Small - Less than one bag

item.title: Asphalt debris being pelted by passing cars and flood, 14th February
item.description:
In addition to the previously reported potholes along the stretch between Wendover Road and Halfords, the road and kerbside are currently covered in loose asphalt pebbles. I have witnessed these being projected at speed onto the pavement by passing vehicles, posing a risk to pedestrians. The carriageway and kerbside require urgent sweeping and clearing to prevent potential injury. Furthermore, immediately after the bend at Wendover Road, a significant puddle forms whenever it rains. I recently drove through this section within the speed limit during the evening (I didn’t notice the puddle) and created a substantial splash. Fortunately, no pedestrians were present at the time, but anyone on the pavement would likely have been drenched. This suggests inadequate drainage.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 107, Masons Hill, Widmore, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
